Dear Provider
Thank you for submitting the Quarterly Financial Report (QFR) for the {REPORTING_PERIOD}. This email is to advise that your residential care data has been reviewed and your action is required before it can be accepted by the Department of Health and Aged Care (the department).
Your submitted residential care data has been reviewed against the following items:
Care funding claimed compared with the direct care hours reported in the Residential Care section of the QFR Care funding claimed compared with the care expenditure reported in the Residential Care section of the QFR Average hourly costs rates for direct care staff (registered nurses, enrolled nurses and personal care workers or assistants in nursing).x consistency compared with previously submitted care hours and expense data.
The department has determined that the residential care data you have submitted is outside the expected ranges for your residential aged care service/s across as follows:
{SERVICELINEITEMLIST}
You must respond and/or action any request to review or amend your data. Where a re-submission is required, this must be done by {TBD}.
If you do not action the departmentâ€™s request to review and/or amend your data or, your re-submitted data has not met the reasonableness checks including accurate data, it is likely your information will result in distorted records and trends.
It is important to note that your Star Rating may be affected if you do not notify the department that your data is reasonable or if you decide to leave your data unchecked.
For more information on how you can re-check your data before submission please refer to the factsheet {TBD}.
If you require assistance, please contact qfr@stewartbrown.com.au. If you require the QFR Portal to be reopened, please contact health@formsadministration.com.au or (02) 4403 0640.
Regards
Mark Richardson
Assistant Secretary
Residential Care Funding Reform
Ageing and Aged Care
Australian Government Department of Health and Aged Care
